Reviews.Title: “Luxurious classic hotel with all modern creature comforts”
Reviews.Author: born2bwild
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge and beautifully decorated. Food is amazing. Too bad we wanted to see the city, or we would have been content to just stay on the hotel property the entire stay. The only drawback to the hotel is that it is not centrally located. This hotel is best for a romantic tryst or for someone who knows Berlin and has no need to see the sites. It is not for someone who wants to see the city, unless you don't mind a long commute to the city center. The hotel is in a wonderful neighborhood, but not much to see or do within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Makes you feel you are the prince/princess born here”
Reviews.Author: Marondine
Reviews.Content: I had never liked Berlin that much before discovering this hotel. If you are into the modern/urban culture, don't stay here and go to the east side where things are happening. However, if you are after a bit of Unter den Linden romance, this is the place. The setting, salons (one after the other), garden, corridors, rooms, the whole thing is super charming, very grand and exquisite but without being too formal nor impersonal. In fact, the staff make you feel as if you are the prince/princess who were born here. I was a lone single female guest but the staff everywhere made me feel totally relaxed, welcomed, protected and happy anywhere I was, even at the beautifully candle-lit bar in the evening where I was the only single person. The style of the hotel is classical-modern. Everything is real, not repro, combined with the highest quality modern pieces. Everything works perfectly and is certainly not one of romantic-but-dusty. My room was super stylish, very comfortable and well appointed with a beautiful bathroom. I was invited to a very important concert at Berlin philharmonie but seriously considered not attending to that and stayed in all night at this place instead. It is only 15-20 minutes taxi ride to the centre of Berlin, but the drive is beautiful and usually one can pick up good information on Turkish/Persian restaurants in town and/or current political situation of Germany. I had to arrange a rental-car at the end of my stay here, but one of the receptionist did absolutely everything for me. He translated and negotiated but also chose insurance options! Berlin still is not my favourite city but now I can't wait to go back there thanks to this place.

Reviews.Title: “our 10th stay there...”
Reviews.Author: PascaleV
Reviews.Content: We visit Berlin 5 to 6 times a year to go to the opera, so we drive to the schlosshotel as our second home. We reach the opera in 15 minutes by car. We are always welcome and feel like "at home" Our children (13) enjoy the pool, the spa, we do to, the service is always perfect. We always arrive late, around 10 or 11 PM and can always have a small bite at the bar, they even open an other salon for us when the bar is too smokey. The hotel is very very quiet, the breakfast a good moment of calm and relaxation, what can I say more? Yes it is not a downtown hotel, but you have very good value on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “romantic place with the taste”
Reviews.Author: Dainis K
Reviews.Content: This was our third coming back in this hotel in last 7 years. And we were not disappointed. If you are looking for romantic place with historical taste still kept in excellent condition, smell of fire place, professional and helpful staff - this is place to go. This is great place to stay in good and/or bad weather conditions. Hotel and local area is friendly for jogging, biking or just relaxing in the pool. As hotel is relatively small, the staff will recognize you from the first day. This gives personal touch to your stay. There is nice restaurant. I had very nice "Old fashion" in the bar. Just be prepared to see many hotel guests from the country with the Kremlin in the capital which may change your relaxing atmosphere near the pool dramatically. As hotel is located outside central Berlin, be prepared to use taxi (around 15-20 Euro to west part of Berlin and 20-25 Euro to Berlin Mitte region). S-Bahn (local train) is very convenient and runs frequently taking only 8-15 minutes to mine destinations in central Berlin, but be prepared to walk 15 minutes to the station. By the way, there is simple but nice cafe in Grunewald S-bahn station with jammy pastry.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Proves You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: russhughes
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cheal hotel, then this one is not for you. If however you are looking for one of the best hotels in Berlin, then you have found the right place. From the moment my wife and I arrived until the end of our 3 day stay, we were treated like royalty. Nothing was too hard for the team to do. The hotel is stunning, the rooms are excellent quality and the setting idyllic. If you go to Berlin you MUST stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Discrete de luxe hotel - also applicable for families with small kids”
Reviews.Author: Flemming_Meineche
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel since we are a familiy travelling with small kids and we would like to have plenty of space around them. This you certainly get with this Schlosshotel which is also part of small LHW (leading hotels of the world). The halls around the main entrance are grandiose and so are the rooms. We had a suite with two seperate rooms with the possibility of putting the kids to bed in the bedroom and spending the time in the "living room". The rooms have all the services that you could think of including free mini bar. We had room service two evenings and were in generally satisfied with this. It was not outstanding as you may expect for a hotel in this category, but then again, we were having room service and were not in a restaurant. I am sure that we could have gone to the fine restaurant in the hotel and had a super meal, but with small kids it is more relaxing (for the parents at least) to eat in the room (instead of having the people sitting at the next table staring at you because your son has put half his plate on the table). We went to the pool two times when staying there and more or less had the whole pool area to ourselves. The big pool had a temperature of 29 celcius so we could stay in this for a long time and the small jazussi was expected very hot. The continental breakfast was not lavish, but everything served was high quality. In addition you could order a hot omelettes. Finally, there was the possibility to have sparkling wine if you were in the mood for that. Only two negatives we experienced during our stay were a) some noise in the morning outside our hotel window and b) that I could not get a seat in the main bar Saturday evening. Regarding the former we were offered to move to another room which we declined since we with small kids were up anyway (We had not informed the reception of the noise outside our window, but somehow they must have picked it up). Regarding the latter there was plenty of space in many of the adjacent rooms - just not so cosy - so difficult to complain about. So in general I will recommend you going here - in particular if you would like to stay somewhere quiet/discrete in Berlin or if you are travelling as a family.

Reviews.Title: “What a wedding reception!”
Reviews.Author: artairman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding reception. Fine old-world hotel built in the early 1900's as a private residence. Excellent food, service, indoor pool, spa, and amenities. Expensive, so would not spend more than a night or two, but clearly a window into the old German aristocracy life. Set in a quiet secluded residencial area about 25 minutes southwest of bustling downtown Berlin. Train will get you to within a 5-miute taxi ride--just have the tavern owner outside the train station call the taxi for you.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Wheretonext69
Reviews.Content: In selecting Schlosshotel Im Grunewald for a two night stay with my teenage children I did consider whether it would be better to stay in the city. The reality is that the railway station is only a ten minute walk from the hotel through a very pleasant suburb. It was good to be able to relax in leafy surroundings after a hard day of sightseeing in the city. If you were there on business it may not suit but for a holiday it was perfect. The service at the front desk was impeccable with very intuitive and considerate staff. Restaurant staff were a bit distracted by a function booking which was taking their time but since I was in good company that didn't spoil our experience.

Reviews.Title: “If you have the means, I highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: babelfish111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Schlosshotel Grunewald for two nights. We chose a room with a reading corner in addition to the desk so that we would have a bit more space. The service in this hotel was excellent. The room was very quiet and the area is very relaxing. It was a nice touch that the minibar was "free" (i,.e. included in the price). Breakfast was not included in the price and cost ca. 24 euros more per person. The breakfast was very good with a choice of high quality meats, cheeses, breads etc etc with a chef on hand to make egg-dishes with bacon etc etc and one could get all sorts of coffee/espresso that one desired. It is worth remembering that this hotel is not in the centre of Berlin and the public transport connections are not that great: if you want a city-trip, this is not the right place to stay, if you want to relax in beautiful surroundings, it is the place to stay. The only (minor) downside: we had room service twice we just felt the dishes lacked "that special something" (?inspiration?) that one might expect for the price: whilst the quality of the ingredients was very high and the cooking executed at a very high technical level, there was just something missing. In any case, this only a very very minor issue and we would definitely stay there again. The hotel isn't cheap, but to quote Ferris Bueller: "If you have the means, I highly recommend it"

Reviews.Title: “What a let down! Think twice...”
Reviews.Author: Dopeysnowy
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel simply because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and the fact that the hotel was rated number 1 in Berlin. This just shows the perils of relying on Trip Advisor too much, as it really was a let down. I suggest you think carefully what you are looking for before deciding to book it. The hotel is undeniably grand, has a nice pool and grounds, some interesting history and has some lovely features...but it is let down in a number of ways. Firstly the location. Yes it's undeniably a nice part of town if you're planning on spending your time sat outside in the grounds of your hotel, but if you're going to be sight seeing it really is not the place to be. There is nothing of note in the area, so you really have to get a taxi or the metro everywhere. Given that half the joy of Berlin is the ability to walk to so many places this was disappointing. Secondly, the service. A lot has been talked about the quality of the service and yes many of the staff were very good. But it certainly wasn't all. We arrived in the evening so decided to eat in the hotel restaurant. There was only one other person in there when we arrived (at around 9pm) and when we asked the waitress if they were still serving she looked at her watch, raised her eyebrows and said that she would have to check with the chef. She reappeared and said that we could in a very begrudging manner. Not exactly a warm welcome! She offered us what turned out to be the fine dining menu but it didn't correspond to the menu we had seen in the hotel information in our room, so we were confused. We asked whether there was another menu and the waitress reluctantly gave us what turned out to be the a la carte menu and she then proceeded to tell us in a very condescending manner that people usually didn't order off it because it wasn't fine dining. Looking at the menu I couldn't make any distinction, certainly not in price with main courses around the 30Euro mark. We ordered and later got chatting to another waiter who proceeded to tell us how he hated working at the hotel and couldn't wait to leave...not very reassuring to hear as a guest! By the time we reached the end of our main course we felt completely abandonded in the empty restauarant. Nobody came to refill our glasses or offer more drinks or even dessert, and when we wanted to leave we then had to wait 15 minutes for somebody to deign to appear to allow us to sign the bill! All in all a thoroughly soulless and unimpressive experience!! Thirdly, the room. Our suite was under the eaves and was a bit of an odd design. The decor wasn't exactly shabby chic more just a little worn out! There were some nice touches, the iMac in the living area was great and the wifi was good speed. But the bed was a disaster!! Call me old fashioned but surely one of the most important aspects of any hotel is how good the bed is? The mattress was clearly old, you could feel the springs, but it was also covered with a plastic/rubber mattress protector! Yuck!! This not only made the bed really hot to sleep in but it was also seriously uncomfortable and small. To be honest I'd have sacrificed the iMac for a decent bed any day!! The pillows had also clearly seen better days and were very uncomfortable, plus they were filled (as were the duvets) with feathers of some description. An allergy nightmare for those that suffer from this...and no alternatives appeared to be on offer. The air conditioning had likewise seen better days. We had it on the lowest setting with full fan and were still too hot. We both had a terrible night...not good!! Finally, the bathroom. For a suite I expect a decent size bathroom. It wasn't. It was cramped with only one sink with very litte counter space and the whole thing seemed really dated. I took a shower and when I opened the door when I'd finished the floor was totally flooded (I had closed the door properly before you ask...). I spent the next 5 minutes mopping up the floor with towels...not quite what I'd expect from a 3 star hotel let alone a 5 star one. To put the above comments in perspective we were paying around 350 Euro a night for the room, so this wasn't a cheap stay. We've stayed at luxury hotels around the world and its easy to find yourself getting picky about things, but there were some fundamental failings at this hotel. But the bed was for both of us the biggest problem and neither of us could face another night in it. So regrettably we actually left the hotel earlier than planned and moved into the centre of the city for the rest of our stay, where we had a much more enjoyable time. If you have to go through the inconvenience of moving hotels then I think that sums up why we felt the Schlosshotel such a let down.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable!”
Reviews.Author: sf_travel8
Reviews.Content: One of the finest hotels I've stayed in. The service was amazing. You will not regret a stay here. It's quite a romantic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Service”
Reviews.Author: Hanassi1957
Reviews.Content: My Family stayed here for 7 days and had amazing time- excellent service which is saying something in Berlin ! Worth the money !!! 5stars

Reviews.Title: “Everything superb.”
Reviews.Author: ManilaMacedon
Reviews.Content: When you enter this place, you immediately know you're in one of the most elegant addresses in Berlin. Service at reception was excellent, and I was given a tour of the facilities after I unpacked. I kept being told that I was the "prince of the castle", and they really made me feel it. The interiors are just breathtaking, which explains why there was a movie crew filming when I arrived. They were in and out without much fuss though, and I was able to view the truly stunning rooms they filmed in. I also understand how Karl Lagerfeld probably did not want the furniture to compete with the rooms. Great contrast of clean lines with grand details. The nice thing is that it's so grand and yet so intimate. You can really stay in any of the grand living rooms reading a book, and not feel strange, the way you would doing that in the lobby of a very large hotel. Everything in the hotel is understated elegance. The room is decorated very well, with high tech amenities. Free mini-bar, free WiFi and Bulgari toiletries. Breakfast service was superb, and dinner at the fine dining restaurant was fantastic. The indoor pool downstairs was beautiful, and befitting of a hotel of this grandeur. The fitness room was a little small though - most likely an afterthought for newer guests. There is also a large garden with lounge chairs. My most memorable time at the hotel was spent lounging in the garden with tea and cake, enjoying the fresh air. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path, and would probably be fine for people with cars or who are fine with taxis the whole time. It's a great part of Berlin to see, as there's nothing touristy about it. There are bikes that you can use for free to explore the really posh neighborhood. Service here is about as personalized as it gets, and you're made to feel like royalty. My package also included a 60-minute massage from one of Germany's most renowned therapists. Fantastic hotel in every way. Stay here if you want nothing but the best.

Reviews.Title: “Understated luxury in elegant "private palace"”
Reviews.Author: CLB001
Reviews.Content: On our first trip away without the children we were looking for peace and quiet and impeccable service. We got this and more from our fantastic stay at the Scholsshotel. The hotel is in a beautiful suburb of Berlin, but is well connected via the S-train (Grunewald station) and there is also a bus stop very close to the hotel. A taxi ride to central Berlin took about 20mins and cost about 15 Euros. On arrival we were met by the most charming host (Luven) - many apologies if I spelt his name incorrectly! He told a little of the history of the place and showed us the very elegant public spaces including a very cosy bar which is well stocked with all manner of beverages including excellent Champagnes and Whiskies. The wood panelled bar is smoking, not a plus for us, but you can take drinks in any of the other drawing rooms adjacent to the bar. Our host also offered us a welcome drink (Champagne, of course!) which sat and enjoyed whilst our bags were whisked upstairs and we relaxed into our opulent surroundings. The hotel was seemed to be quiet during our stay (or maybe the other guests were very discreet!), and at some times, it felt like our own private house. We were staying on a spa package (excellent value) for 2 nights in a suite. The suite was spacious and nicely furnished, but I think that if you want one of the grander suites (like the Lagerfeld designed ones shown on the website), you would need to specifiy and book the higher room class. It had a separate sitting area and there was a kitchenette (no utensils or crockery, so not sure if this option is used much). We had 2 mini-bars, both of which were stocked (no wine/champagne) and included in the room rate. Minor niggles were no mirror above the dressing table in the bathroom, underpowered hairdryers and no little dishes (which I would have liked to put my jewellery on!). We were in a room at the back to the hotel and in the morning we did hear some noise from delivery trucks, but it was not too bad and not enough to want to make us move. But these were minor points and easily looked over as the service and facilities were excellent throughout the hotel. The "spa" element of our stay was a massage on day 1 and manicure or pedicure on day 2. Being fairly sporty and used to burly massage therapists in ski resorts, we were not expecting too much from our relaxation massages, but we were both very pleasantly surprised. The therapist managed to get the balance between effective massage and relaxation bang on and it was perhaps the best such massage I have had. The manicure the next day was just OK, but I am quite particular about manicures, so don't be deterred as the cuticle work was good and the hand massage lovely. The spa was small but well equipped - swimming pool was an adequate size to have a decent swim and had a jacuzzi to the side. Unfortunately the steam room was being maintained when we were there, but there was a Swedish sauna, cold plunge pools (are you joking!!?), massage shower and solarium. After a pleasant spa day, we had dinner on our second evening in the fine dining restaurant, Vivaldi. You can have a set menu, tasting experience or choose a la carte - the staff were very flexible and accomodating to my particular needs and I felt that anything I asked for would be no trouble which was refreshing. Had Champagne courtesy of the hotel as an aperatif and a great bottle of wine recommended by the sommelier. The wine list was interesting and had some great local wines to choose from as well as the more recognisable old and new world classics. Overall, we had a wondeful stay at the hotel and would definitely return. We have stayed in some amazing hotels around the world including a few Small Luxury Hotels (which this is one) and I remember it favourably amongst the city hotels we have stayed in. However, it was the hotel staff that made this a special stay for us - from Luven, the porter (whose name we never learned!) to the beautican and restaurant staff - everyone smiled and made us feel welcome in a down to earth and genuine way. We highly recommend staying at the Schlosshotel when in Berlin - we will certainly make a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “great escape”
Reviews.Author: ghosteater
Reviews.Content: Outstandingly good experience. This facility caters to both the upscale leisure traveller as well as the business executive in need of regaining breath after a hefty day at work. In particular we enjoyed the staff who at all times were helpful and showed a great deal of what I tend to refer to as "emotional intelligence." No need to ask for things - once your habits are known to the house, things will flow just naturally. As far as the place itself is concerned - let the pictures speak for themselves. Impeccable. We shall most certainly be back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “diamond”
Reviews.Author: JuliusCF
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife for 2 nights during the Fruit Logistiga 2011 in Berlin. After a long day working we were really happy to know that we are going to stay and rest in a hotell that gives us total posibillity to rest and sleep well. If you want to go to center, you can always take the taxi to city center (10 €) or like us we walked in the nice road to the shopping and restaurant streets. If you want just party than take hotell in Mitte. Personality really great, rooms, brekfast, the hotell it self a Diamond ! Next time it will be easy to chose the hotell, it is Alma Schlosshotell.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BunnyGoesDancing
Reviews.Content: Before we went I was told "You wont want to leave the hotel if you're staying there". It's absolutely true. The Schlosshotel Im Grunewald is my absolute favourite hotel. Utterly decadent and beautiful it is a perfect place to stay if you want some relaxation time away from the hustle and bustle of Berlin. The staff are exceptionally helpful and very hard working. They will go out of their way to ensure you have everything you need. The staff are very knowledgeable about all the main tourist attractions but can also recommend some lesser know things to see/do. The hotel and rooms are all beautifully decorated and are very warm and cosy. The atmosphere is very intimate and romantic. It's very easy to lose all track of time while drinking mulled wine on the cosy sofa in front of the open fire. The spa is lovely and is very clean. The treatments are brilliant and although costly are definitely worth treating yourself to. I will definitely be visiting this hotel again. I didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Schlosshotel is incredibly elegant, charming and welcoming. The best hotel I ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: Yana_M25
Reviews.Content: The Schlosshotel is a legend. The rooms are gorgeous, some with libraries and terraces. I have stayed here twice and have loved every stay. Each room is distinctly decorated by various artists. The atmosphere is very charming. The stuff is really very kind and always ready to help. The Schlosshotel is just my favorite hotel. It's very grown up, almost like another world and time, you feel yourself like you are in the castle( obviously it is) and it's so romantic... Many thanks for Operations Manager and to everybody from this hotel for unforgettable time. With my best regards, Yana M.

Reviews.Title: “By far the most beautiful in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: TrophyCollector
Reviews.Content: I had not been to the Schlosshotel for a couple of years and was so delighted to come back. This is the only hotel in Berlin with true grandezza, elegance and authentic style. It is my absolute Nr. 1, by far, in front of The Regent, The Adlon and maybe The Concorde and way in front of the faux-Dubaian-style Ritz-Carlton. The interior design is worthy of a Palais, but not too heavy, with some modern touches. Food is excellent. The bar is one of the best in the world and it still provides a possibility to smoke cigars. Wonderful! The inside swimming pool is also a nice asset, just as the al fresco terrace and the romantic garden.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at the Schlosshotel Im Grunewald made our 15th wedding anniversary vacation perfect.”
Reviews.Author: ArtFrog
Reviews.Content: This luxurious hotel in a tranquil part of Berlin and their exceedingly friendly staff has now become our top choice in places to travel. Every staff member was always smiling and eager to help with any requests and all spoke perfect English which made the experience very relaxing. The food is magnificent in both the bar and the Vivaldi restaurant. The Chef was so kind for answering our questions about the delicious things we tried and he made a lovely special treat for our anniversary dinner. The breakfast was served in a glass solarium and is quite varied, substantial and scrumptious. The Linzer type cookies that are left on your pillow at night are to die for. The hotel is beautiful and everything that you would dream a schloss to look like yet still have the modern amenities of large flat screen TVs and gorgeous marble bathrooms equipped with everything you need. The terrace and garden were a real luxury in the city and so very nice to relax on the lounges with a book for a quick nap. The best part is the location. It is close to locally used walking paths in the forest around a beautiful lake that takes you to another Historic Castle/Hunting Lodge. At 5pm many local people came to walk their dogs there and get a bit of fresh air. I felt completely safe walking by myself. We took taxis into the city center which were only about 15 Euros and the airport is only 15 minutes away as well. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: kristiak
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect topped of by the fantastic dinner in the Vivaldi restaurant with a unforgettable wine list. We will return to Alma every time we visit Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “we will come back”
Reviews.Author: DAL70
Reviews.Content: A lovely, really beautiful and elegant hotel in a very quiet location. We loved everything: the staff was very welcoming and courteous, the bedroom well appointed with incredibly comfortable bed and lovely bedlinen, the common room elegant but not pretentious: it looked more like the private residence of a (very, very wealthy) friend than a hotel. We certainly will come back

Reviews.Title: “Seamless”
Reviews.Author: MataiDubai
Reviews.Content: Having just completed a 4 night stay this hotel is seamlessly run and quite frankly superb. Located in a beautiful residential area it is a quiet haven with gorgeous stately homes as neighbours. The staff discretely go about their business and things just happen. Evening turndown is always perfectly timed, towels are changed even if you don't leave everything on the floor/in the bath (because lets face it we all want fresh towels but never know if they'll actually be changed!). The local konditorei is yum scrum and the hotel is more than eager to send up plates, forks and napkins on request for your afternoon torte (it's a holiday afterall!). Local restaurants are superb (particularly Capriccio). Vivaldi restaurant in the hotel is also fabulous. The setting from a bygone era but still with a modern touch. The Grunewald offers a great running track to burn off those calories and Berlin is of course one of the great cities of the world.....there's nothing more to be said.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: PascaleV
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days and enjoyed every minute of it. Exceptional service, nice pool. Rooms are well maintained, clean and beautifully decorated. Beds are turned down every night. Restaurant and breakfast buffet were nice, delicious, with excellent service. 10 minutes with car from Berlin! Wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nmt101
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location just out side the city with a luxurious decor within. For me it was the warmth of the staff that made you feel at home as nothing was a problem or too much for them greatly recommend a visit

Reviews.Title: “Berlin's one and only best hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: KarinaMilovidova
Reviews.Content: According to some reasons I do travel to Berlin at least 4 or 6 times a year. I used to live in the city for three years earlier. And I know Berlin by heart. I adore this city. But untill I came first in may 2009 to Schlosshotel Grunewald I was not thinking of Berlin as of relaxation city. Schlosshotel was redesigned perfectly by Karl Lagerfeld, which is important. The whole building is an outstanding work of architecture. Like in a fairy tale you enjoy country air and can't help admiring antique decoration of the hotel mixed with the very modern and professional managing. I can not imagine better place for me to stay in Berlin. The location is comfy:15 minutes car drive from city centre. Nearby there's an outstanding Italian restaurant. The food that is served in the hotel is wonderfull, cooked properly, creative and classy at once. The staff respondes to your every request. In may they arranged the whole european trip for me, this time during my second stay it was very pleasant that after big shopping the staff arranged the taxi driver to pick up my heavy bags from the boutiques and to deliver them to the hotel, though I could continue my way without any need to pull all those nice purchases myself from shop to shop. All the rooms in the hotel are very cosy, quite big and airy. Just one point to be aware of: in hot summer it is better not to stay in the rooms with small windows situated directly under the roof, it will be too hot. As well the air conditioning system is not the modern one, and may be noisy. Some technical details (like curtains) should be replaced with the automatic ones. But those small details never spoil the whole sweet thing! BRAVO Schlosshotel Grunewald! I will be back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “This Is a Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: THECLEVERADVISOR
Reviews.Content: Simply perfect and properly priced. excellent breakfast, room service, spa, rooms and service. Rare gem to find for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the relax and elegance”
Reviews.Author: GARCONBCN
Reviews.Content: Incredible new Schlosshotel im Grunewald. The second time I went to Berlin I decided stay again in the Schlosshotel. It was incredible the renovations and new style I saw there . Our room has news lignts , new tvs, news radios " tivolis" new colours in the walls, new curtains . It was fantastic to be a guest in the Schloss. The Libray it was the best place to relax ,reading spanish, german and catalan literature.... The picnic in the garden was the most suitable and diferent one I never have seen. The mediterranean buffet with the excellent products allow you to taste the best food in Berlin. We decided to take the bicycles and when through the maravellous lake near the hotel.I am sure our stay in this hotel it will be very different that you have never seen before.

Reviews.Title: “Good value luxury”
Reviews.Author: Sprinkle_Nor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in may and had a great time. The staff was very friendly and we felt rely welcome. Our room was nice and clean. The spa also was a great experience, you shod defiantly try it!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful seclusion - for gastronomics with deep pockets !!”
Reviews.Author: Tones100
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weekend nights at the beginning of May 2007. It's about an hour on the metro from Schoenfeld Airport, changing once at the Westkreuz metro station and waiting on the platform for the corresponding train to arrive. The hotel is located in the peaceful and upmarket residential area of Grunewald, and is about a 10-15 minute walk from Grunewald metro station or 5 minutes on the bus which departs from the metro station every 20 minutes or so. As we were only travelling with hand luggage (it was a weekender) we opted to wander through the leafy suburban lanes to the hotel. This walk from Grunewald Metro station is on the flat wide pavements, and we admired an array of parked up Porsches behind which stood some architecturally interesting private houses. After the short walk from the metro you turn right into a quiet street and halfway down you find the impressive Schlosshotel waiting for you. After entering the gated courtyard and walking up the steps into the hotel you wander through the spacious marbled lobby area which leads into the great hall. Check-in just off the lobby is discrete, professional and the staff attitude perfect. The "grandeur" of the great hall certainly doesn't disappoint - and comes complete with imposing staircase, large chandeliers, classical piano and a huge presentation of freshly arranged flowers which filled the room with a fantastic scented aroma. There are plenty of large comfortable sofas and chairs here in which to sip a cool drink, relax and soak up the rich atmosphere. Just off the hall is the Vivaldi restaurant, a beautifully decorated dining room whose decoration mirrors the decadent richness of the hall. The hall also leads out to the patio area, which was a sun trap when we visited and took our "welcome" drink - nice touch!! Staying on the patio to take an alfresco lunch all washed down with some chilled Sancerre, you really begin to feel you are somewhere "special" as the tranqulity and ambience take effect. The lunchtime menu choice was extensive, the beef stroganoff of particular note and the overall quality of all the fare was top notch. The "specialness" vibe continued upstairs where our accomodation was a "Grand Deluxe" room on the third floor, which consisted of an intimate attic styled boudoir. The bed was huge, a bit soft but very comfortable nonetheless The room had a separate walk-in bathroom - marble everywhere !! With a large bath and separate shower. There was a moderate sized wardrobe and hanging space for suits / dresses. My only criticism of the room was that despite the warm temperature outside, inside it was stuffy and the aircon was pretty ineffectual - so we kept the windows open for the duration of our stay. The hotel has a moderate sized indoor pool and spa area which consists of a small gym area with some weights, a couple of jogging machines and a couple of separate treatment rooms for massages. The sauna and steam room themselves were good but quite small - but we had the place to ourselves mid afternoons when we visited, although I could imagine things getting quite cosy if 5 or 6 couples were using the facilities all at once !! So overall, The Schlosshotel is deserving of praise and is a really great little country house style hotel. It's location is quite out of the way if you want to have sightseeing on your doorstep (taxi to Brandenbug Gate about €20) but if you crave privacy and just want to get away from it all then this is the place for you. The only criticism on this otherwise fantastic establishment was the lack of ingenuity with the menu at dinner. Whilst the food was splendid, there just wasn't enough options to choose at dinner time. The lunch menu was varied and good but in the evening it disappeared and the restaurant could only offer a set 4, 5 or 6 course tasting menu starting at €79 for 4 courses without wine - no Ala Carte option. And a minimum tab of €180 for two without vin seemed overpriced compared to lunch... This was such a shame really - but all was not lost : My top tip if you're staying here and fancy a wander out in the evening is to visit a superb Italian restaurant about 5 mins walk from the hotel on the way to the Grunewald metro station. We dined in the very pleasant restaurant garden, rubbing shoulders with the well heeled locals, and we consumed three delicious courses and drank very well for about €90 all in - including vin and bier !! Its location is on the corner where the Menzelstrasse and Hagenstrasse meet. So overall, Schlosshotel Grunewald is great if you want to get away from it all and just chill in a wonderful green tree lined suburb, but ISNT a city centre hotel with sights on it's doorstep. - Which is why we chose it !! Go there and put your feet up !!!

Reviews.Title: “quiet gem in a residential area”
Reviews.Author: HeikeBerg
Reviews.Content: If you would like to have all the major tourist attractions in walking distance or a quick cab ride away, then you are better off staying at the Hyatt or somewhere more central. But if you are looking to de-stress, the Schlosshotel is perfect! It is tucked into Berlin's quiet and elegant Grunewald/Dahlem residential area. In busy traffic it has taken us up to an hour by cab to get to the Brandenburg gate or Potsdamer Platz and even the Kurfuerstendamm can be a 10-minute drive. That said, we have stayed at the Schlosshotel a few times and will return. You get great value for your money. Each room is individually designed with charming, classical decor. I wouldn't stress too much who the designer is, because if I had known before visiting it could have easily turned me off. But it's actually very tastefully done. In spite of all the curtains and carpets it still feels light and playful. The atmosphere is that of a residence more than that of a hotel. The breakfast buffet is splendid! and the staff is attentive and polite. I have seen someone from the front desk sprint down the block after a guest who had left a glove. In the summer your breakfast on the terrace or in the beautiful garden will easily turn into brunch and then lunch... The pool is not deep but it's warm and nice to lounge around, get a massage, and relax. You might be the only in one there all day.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Tyma
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend here and really enjoyed the experience. The room was stylish, the staff friendly and helpful and the food fantastic. Breakfasts were amongst the best we have had. The short trip from the centre of Berlin is worth it to get to an elegant building in a noise free environment. I could not relate to the comments about smoking; we hate smoke as well but did not encounter this problem the whole weekend

Reviews.Title: “More than just a disappointment....”
Reviews.Author: TheHappySpinster
Reviews.Content: While the decor of this hotel is splendid, it misses the mark in several areas and is, frankly, not worth the price. If you're a non-smoker, you will have no where to run from the cigar- and cigarette smokers who are catered to here (yes, there is a non-smoking section in the dining rooms, but you might as well have a non-peeing section in a pool). When asked if there was a place non-smokers could go, we were directed either outside, or to our rooms. Not nice for a place that charges over $200 a room (minimum) a night. The TV program cards in the rooms do not accurately reflect where the programs are (poor attention to detail, or simply not caring), and the DVD players in the rooms only play Region 2 (Europe) discs, which hardly caters to an international crowd. There are no coffee services in the rooms (a standard, and welcome commodity in much less expensive houses), forcing you to pay outrageous amounts for room service. The food prices are extremely high, and you may find that what you want is not available (as happened to us more than once). The breakfast is 23 euros per person and, while slightly varied, is not worth it. Nor is $20 for a small bowl of spaghetti, or $10 for a bottle of water. We also had poor experiences with the wait staff. While they are polite, and completely bi-lingual, we were charged $25 for our "Complimentary Welcome Drink," which was later "rectified" by offering us six finger sandwiches and two small pieces of cake. The staff is always polite when things go right or wrong, but too many things went wrong too often. And at these prices, it really wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hidden Gem in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Chris&Debra
Reviews.Content: A late booking that turned into a wonderful experience after searching Europe for a 5 star break with Spa. A hotel of the highest quality. Attentive staff who made us feel King and Queen of the Castle throughout our stay. Every need given the utmost attention without being intrusive. One the the nicest Spa's we have experienced (absolutely spotlessy clean with all you could need) - perfect attention to detail - again staff looked after our ever need before we had the opportunity to know we needed it. Resturant absloutely fantastic and a "must do" if you choose this hotel. Travel was easy using local transportation - so its worth the 10 minute journey outside the centre of the City. When we had the opportunity to see other Hotels at the same level in Berlin it was easy to see we had made the right choice. Would not consider staying anywhere else if we revisited Berlin or this area. If you fly through Templehof use a Taxi at around 20 Euro - otherwise you will find it hard to find the hotel. Althought only 10 minutes walk from Grunwald S Bahn (plus a short bus ride), its not easy after a flight. Once you know the transportation system S and U Bahn and bus are great to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerenceM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a great weekend break in Berlin staying at this classy hotel. When you walk into the hotel you immediately realise that you are staying somewhere special. There is a sense of history that permeates throughout the hotel, from the baronial lobby to the fantastic bar that feels like an exclusive gentlemen’s’ club. We were fortunate to be upgraded to a suite, which was stunning and very tastefully designed, as you would expect from Karl Lagerfeld. We loved the antique wardrobe, the Hermes toiletries and the very comfortable bed. All the staff were very friendly and tried very hard to make our stay very pleasurable, although, sometimes you were kept waiting for service a little longer that you would expect at a 5 star hotel. Our main criticism would be with the food at their Vivaldi restaurant. The quality of the ingredients and the preparation were first class but the combination of flavours was far too complex. Possibly because we are used to London restaurants were the favours are much simpler and allow the ingredients to speak for themselves we found the combination at the restaurant a bit strange and not to our palate. Before you book this hotel bear in mind that you will need a taxi to get to the centre, e.g. Brandenburg Gate was 16 Euros. But every taxi driver knew where the hotel was for the return trip and were pleased to take us back to the hotel where the German Football Team stayed during the World Cup. On reflection it was a wonderful hotel and we will definitely stay there again on our next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: windowseat
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE BEST HOTEL IN BERLIN! After weeks of hard work we booked in here as a treat. quite expensive i have to admit,but it was wearth every single euro. the staff is extremely friendly and is treating you like the most important peson they have ever met.you could say: i expect that for nearly 400Euros anyway,but let me asure you that you could get dissapointed in berlin within that prizerange at other hotels. the decoration,coulors,interior design,the lobby,the rooms eveything very classy and personal.never tacky.its like being at a (very rich) friends house.you can sit in the bar/lobby looking around for 2 hours without getting bored(ceiling paintings,sculptures,antiques). The restaurant: just thinking back ...i could cry of joy. its the best food i ever had. a lot of restaurant guides(even the french ones) agree.the best wine ever(be carefull here the prizes are litarely witout any limits),but even that we were able to discuss with the most charming sommelier i have ever met.he was able to tell basicaly fairytales and legends about every single sip of wine. this experience is in my head.locked in.forever.

Reviews.Title: “Wellness, shopping and gourmetdinner”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent, peacefull and very elegant hotel. The staff is young but very professional and attentative. The wellness area is kept in a immaculate state- a drop of water on the floor is wiped clean at once. The restaurant and bar is cosy, elegant and decorated with great care of detail. The breakfastroom is delightfull. We had full value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful romantic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful romantic hotel with great service. The food In Michelin star restaurant Vivaldi Is very good. Our suite (room 10) was very spacious but unfortunately It was located right above the bar. The loud music kept us awake. Visitors are not allowed to make pictures In the hotel without permission…so I can't show you how beautiful the hotel actually Is. The Kurfurstendamm Is 5 minutes by car. PR could be better…I never heard of It until I searched the web.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location, Faultess Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MIG2006
Reviews.Content: Okay, so it's a cab ride in to the City Centre (approx €15), but that distance is a large part of this hotel's attraction. The service from the moment we arrived was friendly, attentive, and efficient. The room was beautifully furnished with amazing attention to detail. The public areas are opulent yet cosy and the gardens and terrace bar are a welcome oasis. If you can cope with the distance from the city centre, then this hotel represents a peaceful and private alternative to similarly priced city hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel, confusing management”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It shows that they have 4 General Managers, 2 different owners and two different managing companies in just one year. As a matter of fact, the hotel is managed by Dorint. Regent is just a franchise label! As I heard, the hotel will be sold and be under new managament again as of Jan 1, 2003! However, the new chef (spangled with two stars from the Michelin guide) is very good and the architecture and design are just stunning. In fact the only 5 star+ hotel in Berlin in a truly historical building, originally built for the last emperors attorney in 1914. And the only 5star hotel in Berlin two have its own garden, splendid in summer for weddings and receptions, also featuring a tanning lawn for the pool users! In short: Rather a city resort than a typical business hotel!
